meanings.definition: A person who is not a slave or serf.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, freemen could own land and make their own choices.
meanings.sent2: The country's laws protect the rights of freemen to live freely.
meanings.sent3: The freemen in the story were happy to be able to choose their own paths.
meanings.sent4: The idea of being a freeman in a world of restrictions felt like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The image of freemen standing tall and proud symbolized freedom for all.

meanings.definition: A person who enjoys civil or political liberty.
meanings.sent1: The freemen of the nation celebrated their right to vote and speak their minds.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, all freemen have the power to influence their government.
meanings.sent3: The freemen at the town hall meeting had lively debates about local issues.
meanings.sent4: The concept of freemen participating in shaping their society is truly empowering.
meanings.sent5: The image of freemen marching for their rights left a lasting impression on the crowd.

meanings.definition: A person who is not under legal restraint or disability.
meanings.sent1: The freemen in the courtroom were able to defend themselves without hindrance.
meanings.sent2: Being a freeman means having the freedom to move and act within the law.
meanings.sent3: The freemen in the race sprinted towards the finish line with no obstacles in their way.
meanings.sent4: The feeling of being a freeman without any restrictions was liberating.
meanings.sent5: The sight of freemen enjoying their rights without fear was truly inspiring.
